newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton market closed for holiday.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton market closed for holiday.

text.p: The Bombay cotton market was closed for a local holiday. Trading resumes on Friday.
On Wednesday, limited arrivals and a shortage of ready stock led to some speculative buying which drove prices of Punjab varieties up but fresh mill buying was poor.

In spot, Punjab saw-ginned moved up 25/30 rupees to 1,600/1,700 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while F-414 rose 15/20 rupees to 1,900/1,925 rupees per maund. Bengal-deshi was 5.0 rupees up at 885/935 rupees per maund.
Gujarat Kalyan (medium-staple) was steady at 13,700/14,000 rupees per candy (355.56 kg).
